name: Best Res. ASHP, Env., PC (EE+DF-FS)

market_entry_year_source.notes: Assume historical penetration is captured in baseline

energy_efficiency_source.notes: Sales-weighted combinations in 2023 of heating and cooling efficiencies (COP) for typical ASHPs (4.48 cool/2.52 heat), GSHPs (5 cool/3.6 heat), and electric resistance + central AC (4.43 cool/1 heat). New/replacement sales numbers drawn from AEO 2023 microdata files (~43% resistance/~53% ASHP/~4% GSHP), available from EIA upon request. Additional performance impacts for this measure relative to the typical electric equipment are accounted for via the savings shape data in `tsv_features`.

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies

installed_cost_source.notes: Total installed cost is average of low/high 'ENERGY STAR Connected Thermostat' values inflation-adjusted from April 2020 to April 2022 plus installed costs for the best ASHP in 2023. Fuel switching costs of 800 2014$ (975 2022$) for tank removal for distillate and propane are added to existing homes costs based on the 2015 EIA report, updating the cost from April 2014 to April 2022, and for all fuel types in existing homes, a new circuit cost of 700 $2022 using the upper bound (assuming a high amperage 240V circuit is required for the HVAC system) from the NV5 report. Additional panel and service upgrade costs are not included under the assumption that the inclusion of aggressive envelope performance upgrades in this measure would reduce the system size (and particularly backup heat requirements) enough that a panel and service upgrade could be averted.

cooling.fraction_derivation: Central AC multiple of 68% was determined as a proportion of total homes with a ducted cooling system where heating is done using any non-electric heating energy source. Total homes with ducted cooling (main air conditioning equipment type = central AC = 1) in the sample is 12,211 homes, and then filtered for homes with non-electric heating system (Main space heating fuel != electricity = 5) 12,211-3,949 homes.
